282: Job DescriptionThe Payroll Administrator must be dedicated, industrious and committed to accuracy in all transactions. The Payroll Administrator will be part of a Payroll Shared Services team responsible for all payroll processing duties and assistance to the HR and Finance teams when necessary. The Payroll Administrator will comply with all professional standards and follow all state and federal regulatory requirements and laws. The Payroll Administrator will have primary responsibility for processing payroll, vendor and interdepartmental contact as appropriate.Essential Functions:* Work within a team to ensure the accurate and timely processing of multi-state bi-weekly payrolls for approximately 1000 -3500 employees, consistent with federal and state wage and hour laws and in accordance with established payroll schedules.* Review and audit payrolls.* Provide additional payroll processing support as necessary.* Effectively manages and integrates high volume of data from multiple sources.* Generates reports to analyze, audit and verify data prior to transmission and after receipt of payroll output to ensure accuracy. Responsible for balancing and reconciling payroll earnings and deduction totals for each payroll cycle.* Assist with the preparation of the Payroll Treasury Reconciliation.* Assist with the garnishments process.* Utilize automated system output such as registers and standard reports to research and correct out-of-balance conditions.* Communicate and document correspondence with all involved parties.* Ensure timely upload of files from payroll processing.* Assist with special processing items such as relocation, bonuses, increases, etc. including file uploads and reconciliation.* Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational seminars and utilizing appropriate reference material.* Responds to and resolves inquiries from employees, HR and Finance teams as needed.* Complete other miscellaneous duties as assigned.* Problem Solving & Analysis - Demonstrates the ability to gather, manage and analyze complex data and issues. Takes a critical and methodical approach when problem solving.* Organizational skills - Ability to multi-task and prioritize daily workload. Ability to meet deadlines and to work independently with minimal supervision. Ability to orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; Arranges information in a useful manner.* Attention to detail - Methodical and meticulous; demonstrates attention to detail.* Team player - Able to work as part of a team.* Risk-management skills - Understands the sources of risk and can evaluate risks, determine and apply methods for their control and mitigation.* Communication: Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills.* Informing: Ability to recognize key issues and effectively communicate to management.Experience:* 3-5 years of experience working within a payroll processing environment. Fundamental Payroll Certification (FPC) a plus.* Ceridian Workforce a plus.* Multi-state payroll processing.* Extensive knowledge of ADP systems (EV5 a plus), iReports, Smart Compliance, eTime.* Knowledge of garnishment processing.* Strong knowledge of payroll tax at the federal, state and local levels.* Demonstrated skills in handling sensitive and confidential matters.* Excellent skills with Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook.* Excellent communication skills.* Flexible and able to adapt in a fast-paced environment.COVID Vaccination Policy:This site is a federal contractor.
